meanings.definition: A brownish deposit resembling soil, formed by the partial decomposition of vegetable matter in wet acidic conditions.
meanings.sent1: The peat in the bog was soft and squishy.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use peat as a natural fertilizer for their crops.
meanings.sent3: The peat in the garden seemed to giggle when stepped on.
meanings.sent4: The peat whispered secrets of the ancient forest.
meanings.sent5: The smell of peat filled the air, reminding me of damp earth and moss.

meanings.definition: To cut and dry peat for use as fuel.
meanings.sent1: They peat the wet ground to prepare it for drying.
meanings.sent2: In the past, people would peat to keep their homes warm.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to peat the imaginary fields with toy tools.
meanings.sent4: She decided to peat her way through the dense forest of paperwork.
meanings.sent5: The workers would peat the land tirelessly under the hot sun to gather fuel for the winter.
